snippet: The Pirates’ offer of $3.8 million was not enough to sign Mark Appel, the only first-round pick not to sign with a team this year.
abstract: MLB Roundup; highly regarded pitching recruit Mark Appel turns down the Pittsburgh Pirates offer of $3.8 million and decides to return to Stanford for his senior season, making him the first big casualty of baseball’s new restrictions on amateur signing bonuses; other news and scores noted.
lead_paragraph: The Pirates’ offer of $3.8 million was not enough to sign Mark Appel, the only first-round pick not to sign with a team this year.

headline.main: Pirates Only Team Unable to Sign First-Round Draft Pick
